aircraft.definition: A physical realization of an aircraft, produced according to the specifications defined for a specific model type.

aircraftModel.definition: An aircraft model represents a generic specification that describes the characteristics of a specific type of aircraft that has been manufactured.

generalIATAAircraftType.definition: A general aircraft type designator as a two-, three-character alphanumeric code designating every aircraft type (and some sub-types) that may appear in flight planning as defined by the International Air Transport Association.

updatedGeneralIATAAircraftType.definition: A new general aircraft type designator, if applicable for aircraft types that have changed.

specificIATAAircraftType.definition: A specific aircraft type designator that may appear in flight planning as defined by the International Air Transport Association.

updatedSpecificIATAAircraftType.definition: An updated specific aircraft type designator, if applicable for aircraft types that have changed.

ICAOAircraftType.definition: An aircraft type designator is a four-character alphanumeric code designating every aircraft type (and some sub-types) that may appear in flight planning as defined by the International Civil Aviation Organization.

aircraftName.definition: The official name of an aircraft by its manufacturer.

aircraftDescription.definition: A description of an aircraft by its manufacturer.

aircraftIdentificationCode.definition: A code unique to a single aircraft, required by international convention to be marked on the exterior of every civil aircraft and appearing in its Certificate of Registration.

manufacturerSerialNumber.definition: A build number used by the manufacturer to uniquely identify each aircraft.

CICTTID.definition: A CAST/ICAO Common Taxonomy Team (CICTT) identifier for this aircraft make/model/series as specified by the International Aircraft Categorisation And Identification Standard (IACIS).

certificateIssueDate.definition: The date that an operating certificate was issued for the aircraft.

aircraftCategory.definition: An aircraft category is an overarching classification, such as airplane, helicopter, sailplane, balloon, turboprop, jet.

aircraftWakeCategory.definition: The category of an aircraft according to their wake turbulance characteristics (including takeoff weight and wingspan). The wake categories are defined by aircraft's Maximum Takeoff Weight (MTOW) and indicatively include: L (Low): <= 19,000Kg, M (Medium): Between 19,000Kg and 140,000Kg, H (High): >140,000Kg, J (Super): Airbus A380.

aircraftWeightClass.definition: The category of an aircraft that can be used to partition an aircraft according to their weight.

aircraftNoiseLevel.definition: The noise footprint of an aircraft in compliance with the applicable noise standards as defined in ICAO Annex 16.

aircraftMaximumTakeoffWeight.definition: The maximum takeoff weight (MTOW) or maximum gross takeoff weight (MGTOW) or maximum takeoff mass (MTOM) of an aircraft is the maximum weight at which the pilot is allowed to attempt to take off, due to structural or other limits.

aircraftOperatingEmptyWeight.definition: Operating empty weight (OEW) or Basic Operating Weight or Empty Operating Weight is the standard basic weight for any particular series or any particular configuration. The operating empty weight (OEW) is the sum of the manufacturer's empty weight (MEW), standard items (SI), and operator items (OI).

aircraftFreightClasses.definition: The types of cargo that can be loaded in an aircraft.

aircraftFreightCapacity.definition: The capacity of goods, but not passengers, that can be carried by an aircraft.

aircraftLoadFactor.definition: A ratio of the aerodynamic force on the aircraft to the gross weight of the aircraft (e.g., lift/weight).

aircraftBodyType.definition: The body type of the aircraft. (i.e. W = Wide, N = Narrow).

aircraftHeight.definition: The physical height of an aircraft.

aircraftLength.definition: The physical length of an aircraft.

aircraftMileage.definition: The distance that an aircraft can travel using a particular amount of fuel.

engineType.definition: The type of engine an aircraft uses.

callSign.definition: The radio call sign associated with an air carrier that is used by pilots and controllers to identify an aircraft over radio frequencies. The unique identifier of the ADS-B (Automatic Dependent Surveillance - Broadcast) transponder unit on board the aircraft.

fleetNumber.definition: The airline ship/fleet number as assigned by the air carrier

aircraftOwner.definition: Details regarding the carrier that owns an aircraft.

aircraftOperator.definition: Details regarding the carrier that operates an aircraft.

aircraftStatus.definition: Details regarding the status of an aircraft.

homeAirport.definition: Details regarding the home airport of an aircraft.

aircraftServiceTypes.definition: The passenger and cargo service types associated with this aircraft, e.g. C: Business Class, F: Freight.

aircraftPAXServiceTypes.definition: The detailed passenger service types associated with this aircraft, e.g. C: Business Class, Y: Economy Coach.

aircraftCargoServiceTypes.definition: The detailed cargo service types associated with this aircraft, e.g. F: Freight.

aircraftTotalSeatCapacity.definition: The total number of seats that are available in an aircraft.

aircraftFirstClassSeatCapacity.definition: The number of first class seats that are available in an aircraft.

aircraftBusinessClassSeatCapacity.definition: The number of business class seats that are available in an aircraft.

aircraftEconomyClassSeatCapacity.definition: The number of  economy class seats that are available in an aircraft.

seatsVariation.definition: An indicator whether a mobile curtain is available and the seats by class may vary.

availableSeatKilometers.definition: The number of seats available multiplied by the number of kilometers flown, as a fundamental unit of production for a passenger-carrying airline.

availableSeatKilometersDomestic.definition: The total flight passenger capacity of an airline in domestic flights in a reference period.

availableSeatKilometersInternational.definition: The total flight passenger capacity of an airline in international flights in a reference period.

revenuePassengerKilometers.definition: The number of kilometers traveled by paying passengers, calculated as the number of revenue passengers multiplied by the total distance traveled.

manufacturerValidityStatus.definition: An indicator whether the aircraft's manufacturer has confirmed / validated the aircraft data.

carrierSeatValidityStatus.definition: An indicator whether the aircraft's carrier has confirmed / validated the aircraft data regarding the seat capacity.

carrierCargoValidityStatus.definition: An indicator whether the aircraft's carrier has confirmed / validated the aircraft data regarding the freight capacity.

aircraftConfigurationVersion.definition: An indication of the physical cabin layout of an aircraft.

airport.definition: An Airport is a type of business ecosystem which is defined as an economic community supported by a foundation of interacting organizations and individuals, according to ACRIS. It is practically a complex of runways and buildings for the take-off, landing, and maintenance of civil aircraft, with facilities for passengers.

IATAAirportCode.definition: The thre-letter IATA code assigned to the airport.

ICAOAirportCode.definition: The four-letter ICAO code assigned to the airport.

airportName.definition: The official name of the airport.

airportLocation.definition: A geographic point designated as the airport location.

airportClassificationLevel.definition: The required coordination level of the airport, ranging from level 1 to level 3, depending on the relationship between operational demand and airport capacity. Note: it may change depending on the summer/winter period, so it needs to be used in conjunction with the dateValidFrom and dateValidTo.

airportAnnualCapacity.definition: The maximum volume of traffic that can be handled by the airport during one year, taking into account an “overall” quality of service including a tax rate acceptable to airline operators and external constraints (curfew, for example). It is generally expressed in number of passengers per year.

airportHourlyAverageCapacity.definition: The maximum volume of traffic that can be handled by the airport on average at an hourly level, taking into account an “overall” quality of service including a tax rate acceptable to airline operators and external constraints. It is generally expressed in number of passengers per hour.

airspaceFlightsCount.definition: The number of aircraft flights in the respective airspace in a reference period.

airportArrivalsCount.definition: The number of aircraft arrivals in the airport in a reference period (based on activated flight plans).

airportDeparturesCount.definition: The number of aircraft departures in the airport in a reference period (based on activated flight plans).

totalAirportATFMArrivalDelayedArrivalsCo.definition: The number of airport ATFM arrival delayed arrivals in a reference period.
related_terms: Total Airport ATFM Arrival Delayed Arrivals Count

airportATFMArrivalSignificantDelayedArri.definition: The number of airport ATFM arrival delayed arrivals (>15 min.) in a reference period.
related_terms: Airport ATFM Arrival Significant Delayed Arrivals Count
Airport ATFM arrival delayed arrivals over 15 minutes

airportATFMRegulatedFlights.definition: The number of flights regulated by Air Traffic Flow Management(ATFM) in this airport.

airportATFMFlightsOutsideSlotWindow.definition: The number of flights outside an ATFM slot tolerance window of [-5 minutes, +10 minutes] in this airport.

totalAirportArrivalsATFMDelay.definition: The total airport arrival ATFM delay time, defined as the duration between the last Estimated Take-Off Time (ETOT) and the Calculated Take-Off Time (CTOT) allocated by the European ATM Network Manager.

airportArrivalsATFMIncidentsDelay.definition: The airport arrival ATFM delay time due to delay code A - Accident/Incident.
related_terms: Airport Arrival ATFM delay Code A
Airport Arrival ATFM delay - AD Disruptions

airportArrivalsATFMATCCapacityDelay.definition: The airport arrival ATFM delay time due to delay code C - ATC Capacity.
related_terms: Airport Arrival ATFM delay Code C
Airport Arrival ATFM delay - AD Capacity (ATC)

airportArrivalsATFMDeicingDelay.definition: The airport arrival ATFM delay time due to delay code D - De-icing.
related_terms: Airport Arrival ATFM delay Code D
Airport Arrival ATFM delay - AD Weather

airportArrivalsATFMnonATCEquipmentDelay.definition: The airport arrival ATFM delay time due to delay code E - Equipment (non-ATC).
related_terms: Airport Arrival ATFM delay Code E
Airport Arrival ATFM delay - Equipment (non-ATC) - AD

airportArrivalsATFMAirportCapacityDelay.definition: The airport arrival ATFM delay time due to delay code G - Aerodrome Capacity.
related_terms: Airport Arrival ATFM delay Code G
Airport Arrival ATFM delay - G - Aerodrome Capacity - AD

airportArrivalsATFMATCIndustrialActionDe.definition: The airport arrival ATFM delay time due to delay code I - Industrial Action (ATC).
related_terms: Airport Arrival ATFM delay Code I
Airport Arrival ATFM delay -  I - Industrial Action (ATC) - AD

airportArrivalsATFMAirspaceManagementDel.definition: The airport arrival ATFM delay time due to delay code M - Airspace Management.
related_terms: Airport Arrival ATFM delay Code M
Airport Arrival ATFM delay -  M - Airspace Management - AD

airportArrivalsATFMnonATCIndustrialActio.definition: The airport arrival ATFM delay time due to delay code N - Industrial Action (non-ATC).
related_terms: Airport Arrival ATFM delay Code N
Airport Arrival ATFM delay -  N - Industrial Action (non-ATC) - AD

airportArrivalsATFMOtherDelay.definition: The airport arrival ATFM delay time due to delay code O - Other.
related_terms: Airport Arrival ATFM delay Code O
Airport Arrival ATFM delay - O - Other - AD

airportArrivalsATFMSpecialEventDelay.definition: The airport arrival ATFM delay time due to delay code P - Special Event.
related_terms: Airport Arrival ATFM delay Code P
Airport Arrival ATFM delay - P - Special Event - AD

airportArrivalsATFMATCRouteingDelay.definition: The airport arrival ATFM delay time due to delay code R - ATC Routeing.
related_terms: Airport Arrival ATFM delay Code R
Airport Arrival ATFM delay - R - ATC Routeing - AD

airportArrivalsATFMATCStaffingDelay.definition: The airport arrival ATFM delay time due to delay code S - ATC Staffing.
related_terms: Airport Arrival ATFM delay Code S
Airport Arrival ATFM delay - S - ATC Staffing - AD

airportArrivalsATFMATCEquipmentDelay.definition: The airport arrival ATFM delay time due to delay code T - Equipment (ATC).
related_terms: Airport Arrival ATFM delay Code T
Airport Arrival ATFM delay - T - Equipment (ATC) - AD

airportArrivalsATFMEnvironmentalIssuesDe.definition: The airport arrival ATFM delay time due to delay code V - Environmental Issues.
related_terms: Airport Arrival ATFM delay Code V
Airport Arrival ATFM delay - V - Environmental Issues - AD

airportArrivalsATFMWeatherDelay.definition: The airport arrival ATFM delay time due to delay code W - Weather.
related_terms: Airport Arrival ATFM delay Code W
Airport Arrival ATFM delay - W - Weather - AD

airportArrivalsATFMNADelay.definition: The airport arrival ATFM delay time due to delay code NA - Not specified.
related_terms: Airport Arrival ATFM delay Code NA
Airport Arrival ATFM delay - NA - Not specified - AD

totalEnRouteATFMDelayedFlightsCount.definition: The number of en-route ATFM delayed flights in a reference period.
related_terms: Total EnRoute ATFM Delayed Flights Count

enRouteATFMSignificantDelayedFlightsCoun.definition: The number of en-route ATFM delayed flights (>15 min.) in a reference period.
related_terms: En-Route ATFM Significant Delayed Flights Count
En-Route ATFM delayed flights over 15 minutes

totalEnRouteArrivalsATFMDelay.definition: The total en-route ATFM delay time, providing an indication of ATFM delays on the ground due to constraints en-route.

enRouteATFMIncidentsDelay.definition: The En-Route ATFM delay time due to delay code A - Accident/Incident.

enRouteATFMATCCapacityDelay.definition: The en-route ATFM delay time due to delay code C - ATC Capacity.

enRouteATFMDeicingDelay.definition: The en-route ATFM delay time due to delay code D - De-icing.

enRouteATFMnonATCEquipmentDelay.definition: The en-route ATFM delay time due to delay code E - Equipment (non-ATC).

enRouteATFMAirportCapacityDelay.definition: The en-route ATFM delay time due to delay code G - Aerodrome Capacity.
related_terms: En-Route ATFM delay - G - Aerodrome Capacity - AD

enRouteATFMATCIndustrialActionDelay.definition: The en-route ATFM delay time due to delay code I - Industrial Action (ATC).
related_terms: En-Route ATFM delay -  I - Industrial Action (ATC) - AD

enRouteATFMAirspaceManagementDelay.definition: The en-route ATFM delay time due to delay code M - Airspace Management.
related_terms: En-Route ATFM delay -  M - Airspace Management - AD

enRouteATFMnonATCIndustrialActionDelay.definition: The en-route ATFM delay time due to delay code N - Industrial Action (non-ATC).
related_terms: En-Route ATFM delay -  N - Industrial Action (non-ATC) - AD

enRouteATFMOtherDelay.definition: The airport arrival ATFM delay time due to delay code O - Other.
related_terms: En-Route ATFM delay - O - Other - AD

enRouteATFMSpecialEventDelay.definition: The en-route ATFM delay time due to delay code P - Special Event.
related_terms: En-Route ATFM delay - P - Special Event - AD

enRouteATFMATCRouteingDelay.definition: The en-route ATFM delay time due to delay code R - ATC Routeing.
related_terms: En-Route ATFM delay - R - ATC Routeing - AD

enRouteATFMATCStaffingDelay.definition: The en-route ATFM delay time due to delay code S - ATC Staffing.
related_terms: En-Route ATFM delay - S - ATC Staffing - AD

enRouteATFMATCEquipmentDelay.definition: The en-route ATFM delay time due to delay code T - Equipment (ATC).
related_terms: En-Route ATFM delay - T - Equipment (ATC) - AD

enRouteATFMEnvironmentalIssuesDelay.definition: The en-route ATFM delay time due to delay code V - Environmental Issues.
related_terms: En-Route ATFM delay - V - Environmental Issues - AD

enRouteATFMWeatherDelay.definition: The en-route ATFM delay time due to delay code W - Weather.
related_terms: En-Route ATFM delay - W - Weather - AD

enRouteATFMNADelay.definition: The en-route ATFM delay time due to delay code NA - Not specified.
related_terms: En-Route ATFM delay - NA - Not specified - AD

airportAverageATCPreDepartureDelay.definition: The average ATC pre-departure delay per outbound IFR flight. The ATC pre-departure delay is the additional time that the aircraft is held at the stand to avoid queuing at the departure runway as reported under IATA Code 89.

airportTotalATCPreDepartureDelay.definition: The total ATC pre-departure delay of the airport. The ATC pre-departure delay is the additional time that the aircraft is held at the stand to avoid queuing at the departure runway as reported under IATA Code 89.

airportATFMSlotAdherencePercentage.definition: ATFM slot adherence is defined as the percentage of departures inside an ATFM slot tolerance window, usually of [-5 minutes, +10 minutes].

averageAdditionalASMATime.definition: Average (i.e. per flight) additional ASMA (Arrival Sequencing and Metering Area) time, which is defined as the difference between the actual ASMA transit time and the Unimpeded ASMA time calculated for non-congested conditions.
related_terms: Additional Arrival Sequencing and Metering Area Time

totalAdditionalASMATime.definition: The total additional ASMA (Arrival Sequencing and Metering Area) time, which is defined as the difference between the actual ASMA transit time and the unimpeded ASMA time calculated for non-congested conditions.
related_terms: Total Arrival Sequencing and Metering Area Time

averageUnimpededASMATime.definition: Average (i.e. per flight) Unimpeded ASMA (Arrival Sequencing and Metering Area) time, which is determined for group of flights with the same parameters (i.e. aircraft class, ASMA entry sector, arrival runway) and represents the transit time in non congested conditions.
related_terms: Average Unimpeted Arrival Sequencing and Metering Area Time

meanContinuousDescentOperationsAltitude.definition: The mean altitude of Continuous Descent Operations during climb and descent at the airport.

continuousDescentOperationsFlightsPercen.definition: The percentage of flights that are considered CDO (and don’t have any considered level flight) during climb and descent at the airport.

averageDistanceFlownLevel.definition: The average distance flown level per flight during climb and descent at the airport.

averageTimeFlownLevel.definition: The average time flown level per flight during climb and descent at the airport.

airportRegulatedIndicator.definition: An indicator whether the airport slot management is regulated.

airportRegulatedTraffic.definition: The number of departure flights that were regulated in the airport in the reference period.

airportRegulatedDeparturesEarly.definition: The number of regulated departures before the slot tolerance window (Early Take-Off Traffic), in the reference period.

airportRegulatedDeparturesWithinSlotTole.definition: The number of regulated departures within the slot tolerance window [-5 minutes, +10 minutes], in the reference period.

airportRegulatedDeparturesLate.definition: The number of regulated departures after the slot tolerance window (Late Take-Off Traffic), in the reference period.

airportUnimpededReferenceTaxiOutTime.definition: The total unimpeded reference taxi-out time as reported by the airport in a reference period.

airportAdditionalTaxiOutTime.definition: The total additional taxi-out time as reported by the airport in a reference period.

airportAverageAdditionalTaxiOutTime.definition: The average additional taxi-out time as reported by the airport in a reference period.

parkingSpacesCount.definition: The airport capacity in parking spaces offered to the passengers.

baggageBeltCount.definition: The airport capacity in baggage belts/carousels, that deliver checked luggage to the passengers at the baggage reclaim area at their final destination.

deicingPadCount.definition: The airport capacity in physical locations where deicing is performed.

totalGates.definition: The number of gates as physical interfaces between the aircraft and the terminal, used to board passengers and crew.

operationalRunawayCapacity.definition: The airport capacity in operational runways used in airport operations. There are two operational runways corresponding to one physical runway; these operational runways are 180 degrees apart.

physicalRunawayCapacity.definition: The airport capacity in physical runways, defined as a delimited rectangular surface region of the airport. Each physical runway is associated with two operational runways, 180 degrees apart.

rampTower.definition: A control tower from which ramp controllers guide aircraft movements as they enter and exit the taxiways, and arrive and leave the gates. The ramp is the area of the airport surface where planes, service vehicles, and people meet.

areaControlCentre.definition: A facility responsible for controlling aircraft flying in a particular volume of airspace (a flight information region) at high altitudes between airport approaches and departures. In the US, such a center is referred to as an air route traffic control center (ARTCC).

taxiWayCapacity.definition: An airport surface leading that connects the ramp area (i.e., the area in the vicinity of the gates) with the runways.

terminalCount.definition: The structures on the airport surface that serves as an interface between people, baggage, and aircraft.

aircraftCount.definition: The number of aircraft flowing through an airspace region per some interval of time.

airportPassengerGroup.definition: Statistics and groups of the passengers flowing through an airport.

arrivalRate.definition: The arrival rate per hour set by the airport during the specified interval. This is the total number of aircrafts that can arrive on all runways combined during an hour.

departureRate.definition: The departure rate per hour set by the airport during the specified interval. This is the total number of aircraft that can depart from all runways combined during an hour.

flowCapacity.definition: The maximum controllable number of aircrafts flowing through an airspace region per some interval of time.

edctArrivalHold.definition: The EDCT (Estimated Departure Clearance Time) hold minutes at other airports arriving to this airport.

edctDepartureHold.definition: The EDCT (Estimated Departure Clearance Time) hold minutes at this airport departing to other airports.

carrier.definition: A business entity that is licensed to operate an aircraft and operates regular services for carrying passengers and/or goods by aircraft.

carrierCode.definition: A two/three-letter code assigned to the carrier.

IATAAirCarrierCode.definition: The IATA code assigned to the carrier which is typically two alpha-numeric characters followed by an optional alpha character.

ICAOAirCarrierCode.definition: The three-letter ICAO code assigned to the carrier.

USDOTCategorization.definition: A categorization whether the carrier is US DOT certified and non-US.

carrierBusinessName.definition: The official business name of a carrier with which it is broadly known.

carrierLegalName.definition: The legal name of a carrier used for its registration to the official authorities

carrierID.definition: A unique ID for an air carrier.

carrierAlias.definition: An alternative name for a carrier.

registrationCountry.definition: The country of the carrier registration.

registrationDate.definition: The date of the carrier registration to the official authorities.

dissolutionnDate.definition: The date of the carrier dissolution from the official authorities, if applicable.

carrierStatus.definition: A code to identify the current status of an air carrier.

carrierLocation.definition: The location of the carrier in which it is based.

carrierServiceTypes.definition: The type of service offered by the carrier, e.g. cargo/mail, charter, cargo, passenger, mixed configuration, surface, etc.

carrierVariationType.definition: The variation type of the carrier, e.g. D = Domestic, I = International, L = Long Haul, S = Short Haul, A = Alternative Layout (use unspecified) and Blank = Unspecified.

carrierOperationType.definition: The operation type of the carrier, e.g. L = Leisure, B = Business, M = Mixed.

carrierAlliance.definition: The airline alliance to which the carrier belongs.

totalFleetSize.definition: The total fleet size that the carrier owns and / or operates.

costPerAvailableSeatKilometers.definition: A commonly used measure of unit cost in the airline industry in a certain time period, expressed in euros to operate each seat kilometer offered, and is determined by dividing operating costs by available seats kilometers flown.

exFuelCostPerAvailableSeatKilometers.definition: A commonly used measure to compare the cost performance of airlines excepting the cost of fuel in a certain time period, as airline fuel cost is generally not viewed as controllable.
related_terms: Cost per Available Seat Kilometers Ex-Fuel

revenuePerAvailableSeatKilometers.definition: A commonly used measure of unit revenue for airlines, expressed in euros received for each available seat mile and determined by dividing various measures of operating revenue by Available Seat Kilometers. This number is frequently used to allow a comparison between different airlines or a comparison of the same airline across periods.
related_terms: Total Revenue per Available Seat Kilometers
Operating Revenue per Available Seat Kilometers

passengerRevenuePerAvailableSeatKilomete.definition: A passenger (or scheduled ticket) revenue per ASK (Available Seat Kilometers).
related_terms: Passenger Revenue per Available Seat Kilometers

carrierFlights.definition: The actual number of flights that were operated by the carrier in a reference period.
related_terms: actual number of passengers by carrier

carrierPassengerGroup.definition: Statistics and groups of the passengers that travelled in flights operated by the carrier in a reference period.

flight.definition: The airborne activity of an aircraft defined by one primary identifier and possibly one or more additional identifiers (i.e. code shares). A flight may comprise from one to many flight legs.

flightID.definition: A unique identifier for the specific flight.

codeShare.definition: A list of all codes used for the specific flight.

sharedAlliance.definition: The strategic alliance to which the specific flight and the involved airlines belong.

flightType.definition: A classification or grouping to which the specific flight belongs, e.g. schedule, operation, cancelled, NOOP, diverted, Redirect, Towing, GroundMovement (Towing), Return taxi, Return flight.

fullFlightRouting.definition: Details for the full routing of the flight with the airports shown as 3 letter IATA codes.

flightLegsDetails.definition: Details for the flight legs that comprise a specific flight.

longestSector.definition: A marker to show the operation that stops at all airports within the Full Routing.

flightElectronicTicketingInformation.definition: An indication whether electronic ticketing of the specific flight is available. A multi-leg flight can be an Electronic Ticketing candidate only if all flight legs are also Electronic Ticketing candidates.

minimumConnectingTimeInternationalDomest.definition: The applicable Minimum Connecting Time based upon the arrival and departure status of the connecting flights.
related_terms: Minimum Connecting Time International Domestic Status

totalFlightStops.definition: The total number of stops on route during this flight.

intermediateStops.definition: A list of stops on route during this flight.

aircraftRotationLayover.definition: A signle numeric value to demote that the layover of the aircraft at the leg arrival station is 24 hours or more.

aircraftRotationLayoverTime.definition: The duration of a stop or transfer (from one airplane to another) up to a certain maximum allowed connecting time.

flightTransitLayover.definition: An indication that there is a layover of the flight at the leg arrival station of 24 hours or more between the arrival and departure of the next leg of the same flight.

flightTransitLayoverTime.definition: The duration of the layover of the flight at the leg arrival station of 24 hours or more between the arrival and departure of the next leg of the same flight.

flightLeg.definition: A single journey (flight segment) from origin to destination, covering the aircraft movement from the departure at the originating airport to the arrival at the destination airport.

flightCode.definition: The flight code as officially used by a carrier and airport.

flightNumber.definition: The flight number refers to the numeric part (up to four digits) of a flight code.

flightSuffix.definition: Extra character indicating that there is a second flight with the same flight number and city pair on the same local departure day.

legSequenceNumber.definition: The sequence number of the specific flight leg.

codeSharingCommercialDuplicate.definition: A code for the carrier actually operating the flight leg(s) in a commercial duplicate code share operation.

codeSharingSharedAirlineDesignator.definition: A code for the carrier actually operating the flight leg(s) on behalf of the carrier specified by the airline designator in the flight designator.

itineraryVariationIdentifier.definition: An identifier assigned to a flight number for the variation of each itinerary.

itineraryVariationIdentifierOverflow.definition: The Itinerary variation Identifier Overflow is used when more than 99 Itinerary Variation Identifiers (IVIs) are required for the same Flight Designator.

flightDescription.definition: A description of the specific flight leg.

operatingCarrier.definition: The airline that carries out the flight, which matches be the airline name on the passengers’ ticket.

marketingCarrier.definition: A carrier with an agreement (with an operating airline) to jointly promote a flight, also known as a code share. A passenger may purchase a ticket from the marketing airline for a flight of the operating airline. The marketing airline may assign their own flight number to the flight and often the marketing airline’s name, logo and flight number are displayed to the public.

flightCategory.definition: A categorization for the specific flight.

flightClassification.definition: A classification for the flight nature.

clearanceAgreement.definition: A specification of the type of clearance agreement.

operatingAlliance.definition: The operating alliance for the flight.

flightOperationalStatus.definition: A status code to denote the operational status of a flight.

flightTPAExtension.definition: An extension added to the IATA specification per trading partner agreement.

flightPubicDisplay.definition: A specification how a flight should be shown on a public display.

flightPubicStatus.definition: Status information for the flight leg that can be displayed to the public.

destinationType.definition: A type to specify the destination type such as local, transit, or transfer.

serviceType.definition: The IATA Service Type values associated with a flight: A: Additional Cargo/Mail, C: Charter-Passenger only, E: Special VIP Flight, F: Scheduled Cargo and/or Mail, G: Additional Flights-Passenger Normal Service, H: Charter-Cargo and/or Mail, I: Ambulance Flight, J: Scheduled-Passenger Normal Service, K: Training Flights, M: Mail Service, O: Charter requiring special handling (e:g: migrants, immigrants), P: Positioning Flights-Non Revenue (ferry/delivery/demo), T: Technical Test, W: Military, X: Technical Stop

technicalStop.definition: An indicator whether the flight leg represents a technical stop. If true, this is a technical stop.  If false, it is not a technical stop

departureAirport.definition: Details for the actual departure airport for the flight.

arrivalAirport.definition: Details for the actual arrival airport for the flight.

alternateDepartureAirport.definition: Details for the alternate departure airport to be used in case of weather, traffic, or other unforseen contingency. The alternate airport is refers to a recovery flight.

alternateArrivalAirport.definition: Details for the alternate arrival airport to be used in case of weather, traffic, or other unforseen contingency. The alternate airport is specified in the flight plan.

cityPair.definition: Details for the city-pair to which this flight belongs.

departureSecurityCheck.definition: An indicator whether additional security checks are required for departure. If true, additional security checks are required for departure.

arrivalSecurityCheck.definition: An indicator whether additional security checks are required for arrival. If true, additional security checks are required for arrival.

specialEmphasis.definition: Used to specify if the flight requires special attention or handling.

scheduledDepartureDateTime.definition: The datetime that the flight is scheduled to depart per the flight plan. It refers to the planned time at which an aircraft will become airborne.

scheduledAircraftDepartureTime.definition: The time when the aircraft is scheduled to depart per the carrier schedule.

scheduledPassengerDepartureTime.definition: The time when the passengers are scheduled to depart per the carrier schedule.

scheduledArrivalDateTime.definition: The datetime that the flight is scheduled to arrive per the flight plan. It refers to the planned time that an aircraft will touch-down on the runway.

scheduledAircraftArrivalTime.definition: The time when the aircraft is scheduled to arrive at destination per the carrier schedule.

scheduledPassengerArrivalTime.definition: The time when the passengers are scheduled to arrive at destination per the carrier schedule.

estimatedDepartureDateTime.definition: The datetime that the flight is estimated to depart according to the latest information / updates / conditions by the carrier.

estimatedArrivalDateTime.definition: The datetime that the flight is scheduled to arrive per the flight plan and the latest updates / conditions.

actualDepartureDateTime.definition: The datetime determined by surveillance data sources to be the 'actual' time of flight departure, versus the scheduled time or the time specified in the flight plan, etc.

actualArrivalDateTime.definition: The datetime determined by surveillance data sources to be the 'actual' time of flight arrival when the aircraft lands on a runway, versus the scheduled time or the time specified in the flight plan.

repeatNumber.definition: The repeat or departure attempt number.

estimatedTaxiInTime.definition: The estimated taxi time between landing and in-block.

estimatedTaxiOutTime.definition: The estimated taxi time between off-block and take off. This estimate includes any delay buffer time at the holding point or remote de-icing prior to take off.

actualTaxiInTime.definition: The period between the Actual In Block Time and the Actual Arrival Time.

actualTaxiOutTime.definition: The period between the Actual Off Block Time and the Actual Take Off Time.

variableTaxiTime.definition: A common name for inbound (Estimated Taxi In Time) and outbound (Estimated Taxi Out Time) Taxi Times, replacing the default Taxi Time

scheduledInBlockDateTime.definition: The datetime when an aircraft is scheduled to arrive in-block, at its first parking position

scheduledOffBlockDateTime.definition: The datetime when an aircraft is scheduled to depart from its parking position and commence movement associated with departure.

targetOffBlockDateTime.definition: The datetime when an Aircraft Operator or Ground Handler estimates that an aircraft will be ready, all doors closed, boarding bridge removed, push back vehicle available and ready to start up / push back immediately upon reception of clearance from the tower.

actualInBlockDateTime.definition: The actual date and time when an aircraft will arrive on-block, when the parking brakes have been engaged at the parking position.

actualOffBlockDateTime.definition: The actual datetime at which the aircraft will start movement associated with departure, pushing back / vacating the parking position.

estimatedInBlockDateTime.definition: The planned date and time that an aircraft will arrive on-block, when the parking brakes have been engaged at the parking position.

estimatedOffBlockDateTime.definition: The planned datetime at which the aircraft will start movement associated with departure, pushing back / vacating the parking position.

targetLandingDateTime.definition: Targeted datetime from the Arrival management process at the threshold, taking runway sequence and constraints into account. It is not a constraint but a progressively refined planning time used to coordinate between arrival and departure management processes.

actualLandingDateTime.definition: The actual date and time when the aircraft has landed (touch down).

estimatedLandingDateTime.definition: The estimated time that an aircraft will touchdown on the runway. (Equivalent to ATC ETA – Estimated Time of Arrival = landing).

targetTakeOffDateTime.definition: The Target Take Off DateTime taking into account the Target Off-Block DateTime plus the Estimated Taxi-Out DatetTime.

actualTakeOffDateTime.definition: The datetime that an aircraft takes off from the runway.

actualReadyDateTime.definition: The datetime when the aircraft is ready for start up/push back or taxi immediately after clearance delivery, meeting the requirements set by the targetOffBlockTime definition.

actualStartUpRequestDateTime.definition: The datetime when the pilot requests start up clearance.

targetStartUpApprovalDateTime.definition: The datetime provided by ATC taking into account Targeted Off-Block Time, Calculated Take Off Time and/or the traffic situation that an aircraft can expect start up / push back approval.

actualStartUpApprovalDateTime.definition: The datetime when an aircraft receives its start up approval.

scheduledDepartureGateOpenDateTime.definition: The scheduled datetime that the originally allocated departure gate will open for a specific flight.

scheduledDepartureGateCloseDateTime.definition: The scheduled datetime that the originally allocated departure gate will close for a specific flight.

actualDepartureGateOpenDateTime.definition: The actual datetime that the originally allocated departure gate will open for a specific flight.

actualDepartureGateCloseDateTime.definition: The actual datetime that the originally allocated departure gate will close for a specific flight.

scheduledNewDepartureGateOpenDateTime.definition: The scheduled datetime that a new departure gate will open for a specific flight.

scheduledNewDepartureGateCloseDateTime.definition: The scheduled datetime that a new departure gate will close for a specific flight.

actualNewDepartureGateOpenDateTime.definition: The actual datetime that a new departure gate will open for a specific flight.

actualNewDepartureGateCloseDateTime.definition: The actual datetime that a new departure gate will close for a specific flight.

actualStartBoardingDateTime.definition: The actual datetime that passengers are entering the bridge or bus to the aircraft.

estimatedFlightTime.definition: The flight duration time estimated by the carrier (the time from off blocks to block time).

actualFlightTime.definition: The flight duration time recorded by the carrier (the time from off blocks in departure to on-block time in destination).

departureAirportSlot.definition: The datetime of the departure airport slot or take-off slot, i.e. the specific time period allotted for the aircraft to take off at an airport.

departureAirportSlotFrom.definition: The start datetime of the departure airport slot, i.e. the specific time period allotted for the aircraft to take off at an airport.

departureAirportSlotTo.definition: The end datetime of the departure airport slot, i.e. the specific time period allotted for the aircraft to take off at an airport.

arrivalAirportSlot.definition: The datetime of the arrival airport slot or landing slot, i.e. the specific time period allotted for the aircraft to land at an airport.

arrivalAirportSlotFrom.definition: The start datetime of the arrival airport slot , i.e. the specific time period allotted for the aircraft to land at an airport.

arrivalAirportSlotTo.definition: The end datetime of the arrival airport slot , i.e. the specific time period allotted for the aircraft to land at an airport.

estimatedTurnRoundTime.definition: The time estimated by the carrier / ground handler on the day of operation to turn-round a flight taking into account the operational constraints.

actualTurnRoundTime.definition: The actual time provided by the carrier / ground handler on the day of operation that was required to turn-round a flight taking into account the operational constraints. It is calculated as the difference of the actualOffBlockTime from the actualInBlockTime.

minimumTurnRoundTime.definition: The minimum turn-round time agreed with a carrier / ground handler for a specified flight or aircraft type.

scheduledTurnRoundTime.definition: The scheduled time provided by the carrier / ground handler on the day of operation to turn-round a flight taking into account the operational constraints. It is calculated as the difference of the Scheduled Off Block Time from the Scheduled In Block Time.

estimatedAirborneDateTime.definition: The estimated datetime that an aircraft will be in the air and flying.

actualAirborneDateTime.definition: The actual datetime that an aircraft is in the air and flying.

flightTenMinutesOutDateTime.definition: The datetime when an aircraft is 10 minutes away from the arrival airport. The aircraft touchdown expected in ten minutes.

actualGroundHandlingStartDateTime.definition: The datetime when ground handling on an aircraft starts, that can be equal to actualTaxiInTime (to be determined locally).
related_terms: Actual Commence of Ground Handling Time

actualGroundHandlingEndDateTime.definition: The datetime when ground handling on an aircraft ends, that can be equal to actualReadyTime (to be determined locally).
related_terms: Actual End of Ground handling Time

actualGroundHandlingTime.definition: The total duration of the ground handling of the aircraft, that is calculated as actualGroundHandlingEndTime - actualGroundHandlingStartTime.

estimatedReadyForDeicingDateTime.definition: The estimated datetime when the aircraft is expected to be ready for de-icing operations

actualReadyForDeicingDateTime.definition: The actual datetime when the aircraft is ready for de-icing operations

estimatedDeicingStartDateTime.definition: The estimated datetime when de-icing operations on an aircraft are expected to start.

actualDeicingStartDateTime.definition: The datetime when de-icing operations on an aircraft actually started.

estimatedDeicingEndDateTime.definition: The estimated datetime when de-icing operations on an aircraft are expected to end.

actualDeicingEndDateTime.definition: The datetime when de-icing operations on an aircraft end.

actualDeicingTime.definition: The duration of the de-icing operations on an aircraft, that is calculated as actualDeicingEndDateTime – actualDeicingStartDateTime.

estimatedDeicingTime.definition: The expected duration of the de-icing operations on an aircraft, that is calculated as EstimatedDeicingEndDateTime – EstimatedDeicingStartDateTime.

deIceLocation.definition: The de-ice location, either at aircraft parking position or remote location.

automatedCheckin.definition: An indication whether an automated checkin service is available for the specific flight leg.

legElectronicTicketingInformation.definition: An indication whether electronic ticketing of the specific flight leg is available.

arrivalDelayTime.definition: The total arrival delay of a flight.

departureDelayTime.definition: The total departure delay of a flight.

arrivalDelayExcess.definition: The arrival delay of a flight in excess of 15 minutes.

departureDelayExcess.definition: The departure delay of a flight in excess of 15 minutes.

delayAssignmentMode.definition: The type of delay assignment mode specified for this delay model, e.g. DAS, GAAP, or UDP.

primaryDelayCode.definition: The primary 'departure delay code' represents the IATA delay codes for reporting flight departure delays.

complementaryDelayCode.definition: The complementary 'departure delay code' represents the additional, secondary IATA delay codes for reporting flight departure delays.

diversionType.definition: Type of diversion (planned, unplanned, etc), i.e. N = Unplanned, P = Planned, T = Tech Stop, A = In Air Return, R = Recovery, L = No Longer Diverted.

remarkCode.definition: A code specifying a remark regarding the specific flight, and may concern the general public, the staff breakroom, the gate.

remarkText.definition: Ad-hoc non-fixed remarks or information where a remark code set value is not defined, e.g. cargo load information which will constantly differ.

diversionRemarkText.definition: Ad-hoc non-fixed remarks for a diverted flight.

scheduledArrivalStand.definition: The planned parking position of an aircraft that arrives to the airport.

actualArrivalStand.definition: The actual parking position of an aircraft that arrives to the airport.

arrivalStandScheduledStartDateTime.definition: The planned, scheduled start datetime for the parking position of an aircraft that arrives to the airport.

arrivalStandScheduledEndDateTime.definition: The planned, scheduled end datetime for the parking position of an aircraft that arrives to the airport.

scheduledDepartureStand.definition: The planned parking position of an aircraft that departures from the airport.

actualDepartureStand.definition: The actual parking position of an aircraft that departs from the airport.

departureStandScheduledStartDateTime.definition: The planned, scheduled start datetime for the parking position of an aircraft that departs from the airport.

departureStandScheduledEndDateTime.definition: The planned, scheduled end datetime for the parking position of an aircraft that departs from the airport.

flightHoldIndicator.definition: An indicator whether the holding (or flying a hold), i.e. a maneuver designed to delay an aircraft already in flight while keeping it within a specified airspace, is required.

departureStandHoldIndicator.definition: An indicator whether the holding of an aircraft is required in the departure stand position.

arrivalStandHoldIndicator.definition: An indicator whether the holding of an aircraft is required in the arrival stand position.

departureStandHoldConflictingStand.definition: A stand hold position of an aircraft during depparture due to a conflicting stand.

arrivalStandHoldConflictingStand.definition: A departure stand hold position of an aircraft during arrival due to a conflicting stand.

departureStandHoldType.definition: The type of the stand hold of an aircraft in the departure airport.

arrivalStandHoldType.definition: The type of the stand hold of an aircraft in the arrival airport.

arrivalGateType.definition: The type of the assigned arrival gate.

scheduledArrivalGate.definition: The assigned arrival gate, as the area of an airport that provides a waiting area for passengers before boarding their flight

actualArrivalGate.definition: The actual arrival gate, as the area of an airport that provides a waiting area for passengers before boarding their flight

departureGateType.definition: The type of the assigned departure gate.

scheduledDepartureGate.definition: The assigned departure gate, as the area of an airport for passengers to embark for their flight.

actualDepartureGate.definition: The actual departure gate, as the area of an airport for passengers to embark for their flight.

preClearedDepartureGate.definition: An indication whether the departure gate used for this flight leg is an immigration 'pre-cleared' gate.

scheduledArrivalAirportZone.definition: The area in the airport which the flight is planned to use at arrival time.

actualArrivalAirportZone.definition: The area in the airport which the flight actually uses at arrival time.

scheduledDepartureAirportZone.definition: The area in the airport which the departure flight is planned to use at departure time.

actualDepartureAirportZone.definition: The area in the airport which the flight actually uses at departure time.

remoteOperationalGate.definition: An additional location used to transfer passengers to or from a remote parking position.

arrivalPublicTerminal.definition: The assigned arrival terminal ID at an airport where passengers transfer between ground transportation and the facilities that allow them to disembark from an aircraft.

departurePublicTerminal.definition: The assigned departure terminal ID at an airport where passengers transfer between ground transportation and the facilities that allow them to board an aircraft.

arrivalAircraftTerminal.definition: The assigned arrival terminal ID at an airport where the aircraft is located.

departureAircraftTerminal.definition: The assigned departure terminal ID at an airport where the aircraft is located.

arrivalCrewBusIndicator.definition: An indicator whether an airside bus is used for the crew on the flight arrival.

departureCrewBusIndicator.definition: An indicator whether an airside bus is used for the crew on the flight departure.

arrivalPAXBusIndicator.definition: An indicator whether an airside bus is used for the passengers on the flight arrival.

departurePAXBusIndicator.definition: An indicator whether an airside bus is used for the passengers on the flight departure.

arrivalRunway.definition: The operational runway for the landing of an aircraft to the arrival airport.

departureRunway.definition: The operational runway for the take-off of an aircraft from the departure airport.

arrivalMarshallingIndicator.definition: An indicator whether aircraft marshalling, i.e. visual signalling between ground personnel and pilots on an airport, aircraft carrier or helipad, is required at arrival time.

departureMarshallingIndicator.definition: An indicator whether aircraft marshalling, i.e. visual signalling between ground personnel and pilots on an airport, aircraft carrier or helipad, is required at departure time.

secureFlightInformationMarker.definition: An indicator whether the flight is subject to regulations.

ghostFlightIndicator.definition: An indicator to show non-operating ghost/funnel flights.

arrivalFlightRules.definition: The type of standard flight rules (VFR or IFR) that were used for the arrival of a flight. VFR stands for Visual Flight Rules and IFR means Instrument Flight Rules. Depending on the weather conditions a pilot may opt for one set of rules or the other.

departureFlightRules.definition: The type of standard flight rules (VFR or IFR) that were used for the departure of a flight. VFR stands for Visual Flight Rules and IFR means Instrument Flight Rules. Depending on the weather conditions a pilot may opt for one set of rules or the other.

scheduledOperatingAircraft.definition: Links a flight with the aircraft that is planned to be used.

actualOperatingAircraft.definition: Links a flight with the actual aircraft that was used.

operatingAircraftChange.definition: An indication whether an aircraft change occured on route.

previousFlightLegAircraft.definition: Details for the aircraft of the upline flight leg, that occured before the current leg.

nextFlightLegAircraft.definition: Details for the aircraft of the downline flight leg, that occurs after the current leg

aircraftPreviousFlightLegCode.definition: The code of a previous flight leg operated by the same aircraft.

aircraftSubsequentFlightLegCode.definition: The code of a subsequent flight leg operated by the same aircraft.

previousFlightScheduledArrival.definition: The scheduled arrival time for the previous flight of this aircraft

actualCargoDetails.definition: Links a flight leg with its cargo information.

commonRoute.definition: Associates a common route with a Standard Instrument Departure Routes (SID) and Standard Arrival Routes (STAR). A SID or STAR has a single common route, but can have multiple airport or transition routes.

scheduledRoute.definition: A string that provides the route of flight proposed in a flight plan. Syntactically, the string shows a path of fixes, airways, SIDs, and STARs, separated by either one or two dots. The string is parsed to create an equivalent ontology representation: an ordered sequence of navigation elements that are associated directly with the flight plan.

actualRoute.definition: Links a flight to its actual trajectory (i.e., a sequence of track points), as determined by flight track surveillance data.

averageAltitude.definition: The average vertical distance of the aircraft measured from mean sea level, during the flight.

tripDistanceMode.definition: The main trip distance condition, that may range from a Great Circle Distance to a Definite Distance value.

tripDistance.definition: The main trip distance, defined as the required great circle distance in still air between the departure airport and the destination airport.

equivalentDistance.definition: The equivalent still air distance of the flight from departure to destination. It is the great circle distance the aircraft would achieve when flying in still air, i.e. without consideration of the wind.

alternateDistance.definition: The alternate distances, defined as the required great circle distance in still air between the destination airport and the adequate alternate airports.

alternateDistanceMode.definition: The alternate trip distance condition, that may range from a Great Circle Distance to a definite distance value.

aircraftTripCount.definition: The number of flights/trips between the departure airport and the destination airport that an aircraft has taken in a reference period.

averageSpeed.definition: The average speed of the aircraft, during the flight.

blockCarbonEmissions.definition: The total carbon emissions ejected between off-block at departure and on-block at destination. It is derived from the block fuel and a fixed factor of 3.16 based on the molecule weight. 3.16 is a constant representing the number of tonnes of CO2 produced by burning a tonne of aviation fuel.

agentDetails.definition: Details regarding the handling agent of a flight leg.

serviceGovernmentApproval.definition: An indicator to show that service is subject to government approval.

inflightService.definition: The facilities/services offered during this flight leg.

inflightMealService.definition: The meal services offered during this flight.

inflightFirstClassMealService.definition: The meal services offered during this flight in the first class passengers.

inflightBusinessClassMealService.definition: The meal services offered during this flight in the business class passengers.

inflightPremiumEconomyClassMealService.definition: The meal services offered during this flight in the premium economy class passengers.
related_terms: Premium Economy Class Meal Service Code

inflightEconomyClassMealService.definition: The meal services offered during this flight in the economy class passengers.

totalCrew.definition: The count of the flight crew.

cockpitCrewCount.definition: The count of the flight cockpit crew.

cabinCrewCount.definition: The count of the flight cabin crew.

crewDetails.definition: Details regarding the crew of a flight.

inFlightLoadedProductsDetails.definition: The details for the products that were loaded in an aircraft prior to departure.

inFlightProductSales.definition: The total amount of product sales that occured during the flight.

inFlightMissingProductsDetails.definition: The details for the products that went missing during a flight leg.

inFlightMissingProductsCost.definition: The total cost of missing products that was observed in the flight. Note: the cost is not the selling price.

inFlightDamagedProductsDetails.definition: The details for the products that were damaged during a flight leg.

inFlightDamagedProductsCost.definition: The total cost of damaged products as counted in the flight destination. Note: the cost is not the selling price.

totalSeatCapacity.definition: The number of total seats that are available in a flight.

passengerLoadFactor.definition: A proportion of airline output that is actually consumed. It is calculated by dividing Revenue Passenger Kilometers by Available Seat Kilometers or by dividing the total number of passengers by the available number of seats.

businessClassSeatCapacity.definition: The number of business class seats that are available in a flight.

premiumEconomyClassSeatCapacity.definition: The number of premium economy class seats that are available in a flight.

economyClassSeatCapacity.definition: The number of  economy class seats that are available in a flight.

flightBaggageDetails.definition: Details for the baggage that are loaded in this flight leg.

flightPayloadCode.definition: A classification regarding the payload that the aircraft is supposed to carry along the defined route.

requestedFlightPayload.definition: The payload that the aircraft is supposed to carry along the defined route as a mass value, e.g. 1000kg.

actualFlightPayload.definition: The payload situation of a flight that can be defined as a mass value, e.g. 1000kg.

actualFlightPayloadPercentage.definition: The payload situation of a flight that can be defined as a percentage. Being a percentage, it reflects the load factor of the underlying aircraft cabin configuration, i.e. 50% of 100 seat configuration with an averaged PAX weight of 100 kg, so 100 kg per 50 seats gives 5000 kg payload.

rampWeight.definition: The total aircraft weight when going off-block at departure. It represents the total weight of a loaded aircraft, including the weight of the fuel and is higher than the takeoff weight by an amount of fuel that will be used while taxiing and running up the engine.

takeOffWeight.definition: The total aircraft weight before taking off at departure.

landingWeight.definition: The total aircraft weight after landing at destination.

passengerYield.definition: A measurement of the average earnings made by an airline by transporting revenue passengers per kilometer flown.

cargoYield.definition: A measurement of the average earnings made by an airline by transporting cargo per kilometer flown.

departureAirportWeather.definition: The weather conditions in the departure airport.

arrivalAirportWeather.definition: The weather conditions in the arrival airport.

enRouteWeather.definition: The weather conditions during the flight.

alternateArrivalAirportWeather.definition: The weather conditions in the diversion, alternate arrival airport.

fuelConsumption.definition: Details for the fuel consumption during the flight.

scheduledCruisingAltitude.definition: The cruising altitude specified in the flight plan for this flight.

actualCruisingAltitude.definition: The actual cruising altitude for this flight.

alternateCruisingAltitude.definition: The actual cruising altitude during flight from destination to alternate.

cruiseSpeedSetting.definition: The  alternative cruise speed setting as defined for the aircraft.

navigationCost.definition: The navigation cost associated with this flight.

totalLegStops.definition: The total number of stops on route

differentDepartureArrivalDays.definition: An indication whether the flight arrives on a different day compared to when it departed, e.g. the next day, 2 days later, the previous day.

scheduledOperationDays.definition: The days of the week that the specific flight leg is scheduled. The days represent the departure days.

flightFrequency.definition: The frequency that a flight leg is scheduled on a daily basis.

flightEvent.definition: A description of an event that has taken place in a flight leg.

flightPassengerGroup.definition: Statistics and groups of the passengers in a flight.

flightPassengerDetails.definition: Details for the passengers in a flight.

passengerReservationsBookingDesignator.definition: A designator for the Passenger Reservations Booking system.

passengerReservationsBookingModifier.definition: A modifier for the Passenger Reservations Booking system.

restrictionCode.definition: The restriction code that applies to traffic rights, stopovers or transfer connections.

trafficRestrictionCode.definition: Information provided by a carrier to specify restrictions to carry traffic or specify limitations on the carriage of traffic.

trafficRestrictionCodeLegOverflowIndicat.definition: Indication of a Traffic Restriction Code Overflow situation.
related_terms: Traffic Restriction Code Leg Overflow Indicator

standardsMapping.name: Traffic Restriction Code Leg Overflow Indicator

targetInBlockDateTime.definition: The datetime when an Aircraft Operator or Ground Handler estimates that the aircraft will arrive in-block, at its first parking position.

scheduledTakeOffDateTime.definition: The datetime calculated and issued by the appropriate unit, as a result of tactical slot allocation, at which a flight is expected to become airborne.

actualGateDepartureDateTime.definition: The actual datetime that the aircraft departs from the originally allocated departure gate.

actualNewGateDepartureDateTime.definition: The actual datetime that the aircraft departs from the new departure gate.

passenger.definition: A person who is travelling in an aircraft but is not flying it, or working on it.

passengerID.definition: A unique identifier for this passenger.

passengerDocumentID.definition: The document ID to uniquely identify a passenger.

passengerDocumentType.definition: The type of document to uniquely identify a passenger.

passengerDocumentIssueCountry.definition: The issue country of the document to uniquely identify a passenger.

passengerDocumentIssueDate.definition: The issue date of the document to uniquely identify a passenger.

passengerDocumentExpiryDate.definition: The expiry date of the document to uniquely identify a passenger.

passengerName.definition: The official first name or set of names, expressed as text, by which this person is known in its identity documents.

passengerFamilyName.definition: The official family name or set of names, expressed as text, by which this person is known in its identity documents.

passengerNationality.definition: A country that constitutes a nationality by origin, birth, or naturalization for this person.

passengerLanguage.definition: A unique identifier of a language related to this person such as their spoken or correspondence language.

passengerAge.definition: A measure of the age of this person such as his/her age at a particular point in time.

passengerGenderCode.definition: A code specifying the gender of this person such as male, female.

passengerBirthDateTime.definition: A date, time, date time or other date time value which specifies the birth date for this person.

passengerBirthLocation.definition: A location where this person was born.

passengerResidenceAddress.definition: A residence address for this person.

passengerContactEmail.definition: The email for communication with the passenger.

passengerContactTelephone.definition: The text string of characters that make up the complete number for this telephone communication, including the country access code for this communication number such as 44, 1, 353 etc

customerLoyaltyCard.definition: Frequent flyer reference, consisting of the ProgramID=airline code and the MembershipID=Frequent Flyer number.

customerLoyaltyLevel.definition: The type of frequent flyer that the passenger has managed to acquire, e.g. gold, silver, blue status.

unaccompaniedChildIndicator.definition: An indicator whether the passenger is an unaccompanied child during the flight.

passengerPRMIndicator.definition: An indicator whether the passenger is a passenger with reduced mobility requiring assistance before/during/after the flight.

seatTypePreference.definition: The seat type preference of the passenger, e.g. window, aisle.

mealTypePreference.definition: The meal type preference of the passenger, indicating any allergies.

passengerHomeAirport.definition: Details regarding the home airport of a passenger.

passengerInFlightSpending.definition: The amount of money that a passenger spends in-flight for duty free products and other in-flight services.

passengerDepartureAirportSpending.definition: The amount of money that a passenger spends in the departure airport.

passengerArrivalAirportSpending.definition: The amount of money that a passenger spends in the arrival airport.

passengerTotalTripSpending.definition: The amount of money that a passenger spends in their trip.

passengerDevice.definition: Details regarding the device that a passenger uses in-flight (e.g. in the IFE system).

passengerGroup.definition: Details for the passenger groups that have travelled in a flight or under a specific carrier, or departed from/arrived to an airport.

passengerGroupName.definition: The name for a specific passenger group that travelled in a specific flight or under a specific carrier, or departed from/arrived to the airport in a reference period.

passengerGroupValue.definition: The passengers count for a specific passenger group that travelled in a specific flight or under a specific carrier, or departed from/arrived to the airport in a reference period.

passengerGroupRange.definition: A range to depict groups of passengers that travelled in a specific flight or under a specific carrier, or departed from/arrived to the airport in a reference period.
related_terms: Self-defined groups of passengers in the airport

passengerGroupPercentage.definition: The percentage of other groups of passengers that travelled in a specific flight or under a specific carrier, or departed from/arrived to the airport in a reference period.
related_terms: Percentage of other passengers groups in the airport

bookingsCount.definition: The number of bookings reserved for a specific slight leg.

estimatedTotalPAXCount.definition: The estimated number of passengers that are expected to travel in a flight or under a specific carrier, or departed from/arrived to the airport in a reference period.

actualTotalPAXCount.definition: The actual number of passengers that travelled in a flight or under a specific carrier, or departed from/arrived to the airport in a reference period.

estimatedTransferPAXCount.definition: The estimated number of transfer passengers that are expected to travel in a flight or depart from/arrive in an airport.

actualTransferPAXCount.definition: The actual number of transfer passengers that travelled in a flight or depart from/arrive in an airport.

estimatedTransitPAXCount.definition: The estimated number of transit passengers that are expected to travel in a flight or depart from/arrive in an airport.

actualTransitPAXCount.definition: The actual number of transit passengers that travelled in a flight or depart from/arrive in an airport.

actualFirstClassPAXCount.definition: The actual number of first class passengers that travelled in a flight or under a specific carrier.
related_terms: actual number of first class passengers

estimatedBusinessClassPAXCount.definition: The estimated number of business class passengers that are expected to travel in a flight or under a specific carrier.
related_terms: estimated number of business class passengers

actualBusinessClassPAXCount.definition: The actual number of business class passengers that travelled in a flight or under a specific carrier.
related_terms: actual number of business class passengers

estimatedPremiumEconomyPAXCount.definition: The estimated number of premium economy class passengers that are expected to travel in a flight or under a specific carrier.
related_terms: estimated number of premium economy class passengers

actualPremiumEconomyPAXCount.definition: The actual number of premium economy class passengers that travelled in a flight or under a specific carrier.
related_terms: actual number of premium economy class passengers

estimatedEconomyPAXCount.definition: The estimated number of economy class passengers that are expected to travel in a flight or under a specific carrier.
related_terms: estimated number of economy class passengers

actualEconomyPAXCount.definition: The actual number of economy class passengers that travelled in a flight or under a specific carrier.
related_terms: actual number of economy class passengers

estimatedPriorityPAXCount.definition: The estimated number of priority passengers that are expected to travel in a flight or under a specific carrier.

actualPriorityPAXCount.definition: The actual number of priority passengers that travelled in a flight or under a specific carrier.

estimatedPRMCount.definition: The estimated number of passengers with reduced mobility that are expected to travel in a flight or under a specific carrier, or depart from/arrive to the airport in a reference period.

actualPRMCount.definition: The actual number of passengers with reduced mobility that travelled in a flight or under a specific carrier, or departed from/arrived to the airport in a reference period.

estimatedInfantsPAXCount.definition: The estimated number of infant passengers that are expected to travel in a flight or under a specific carrier, or depart from/arrive to the airport in a reference period.

actualInfantsPAXCount.definition: The actual number of infant passengers that travelled in a flight or under a specific carrier, or departed from/arrived to the airport in a reference period.

infantsPAXPercentage.definition: The percentage of infant passengers that travelled in a flight or under a specific carrier, or departed from/arrived to the airport in a reference period.

estimatedChildrenPAXCount.definition: The estimated number of children passengers that are expected to travel in a flight or under a specific carrier, or depart from/arrive to the airport in a reference period.

actualChildrenPAXCount.definition: The actual number of children passengers that travelled in a flight or under a specific carrier, or departed from/arrived to the airport in a reference period.

childrenPAXPercentage.definition: The percentage of children passengers that travelled in a flight or under a specific carrier, or departed from/arrived to the airport in a reference period.

estimatedUnaccompaniedMinorPAXCount.definition: The estimated number of unaccompanied children passengers that are expected to travel in a flight or under a specific carrier. or depart from/arrive to the airport in a reference period.

actualUnaccompaniedMinorPAXCount.definition: The actual number of unaccompanied children passengers that travelled in a flight or under a specific carrier, or departed from/arrived to the airport in a reference period.

unaccompaniedMinorPAXPercentage.definition: The percentage of unaccompanied children passengers that travelled in a flight or under a specific carrier, or departed from/arrived to the airport in a reference period.

estimatedAdultsPAXCount.definition: The estimated number of adult passengers that are expected to travel in a flight or under a specific carrier, or depart from/arrive to the airport in a reference period.

actualAdultsPAXCount.definition: The actual number of adult passengers that travelled in a flight or under a specific carrier, or departed from/arrived to the airport in a reference period.

adultsPAXPercentage.definition: The percentage of adult passengers that travelled in a flight or under a specific carrier, or departed from/arrived to the airport in a reference period.

estimatedEldersPAXCount.definition: The estimated number of elderly passengers that are expected to travel in a flight or under a specific carrier, or depart from/arrive to the airport in a reference period.

actualEldersPAXCount.definition: The actual number of elderly passengers that travelled in a flight or under a specific carrier, or departed from/arrived to the airport in a reference period.

eldersPAXPercentage.definition: The percentage of elderly passengers that travelled in a flight or under a specific carrier, or departed from/arrived to the airport in a reference period.

booking.definition: An arrangement made to have air tickets at a particular time in the future

bookingID.definition: A unique identifier for this booking, i.e. the Booking Reference Number that uniquely identifies a booking.

ticketNumber.definition: A unique identifier for the ticket that refers to a specific booking.

itinerary.definition: The details of the itinerary being booked.

bookingDate.definition: The timestamp when the booking was made.

ticketIssueDate.definition: The timestamp when the ticket was issued.

travelDate.definition: The timestamp when the travel will take place.

passengerNameRecord.definition: Information provided by the passenger and collected by airlines, in the normal course of their business, for enabling reservations and carrying out the check-in process.

travellerDetails.definition: Details for the person(s) that this booking concerns.

baggageDetails.definition: Details for the baggage that the person(s) of this booking carry.

cabinClass.definition: The cabin class of the specific booking, i.e. first class, business, premium economy, economy

fareClass.definition: The fare class of the booking and any restrictions that may apply to the ticket.

taxAmount.definition: The tax amounts paid to the relevant authorities involved in the itinerary.

paymentMethod.definition: The form of payment used, as this will usually restrict any refund if the ticket is not used.

seatAllocation.definition: The seat allocation of the passenger(s) per flight leg.

specialServiceRequest.definition: A description of the special service request a passenger has at the time of the booking.

otherServiceInformation.definition: Additional information sent to a specific airline, or all airlines in the booking, which enables them to better provide a service.

travelAgentDetails.definition: Details for the travel agent or airline office.

purpose.definition: The purpose of the booking, e.g. for holidays or business reasons.

travelPackage.definition: A description for the travel package associated with this booking, e.g. forindependent, with group, etc.

travelDuration.definition: The duration of the trip associated this booking, typically measured in number of nights.

product.definition: The details for the products loaded in an aircraft.

productID.definition: A unique identifier for the product.

productType.definition: A specific type associated with the product.

productCategory.definition: The category to which the product belongs, e.g. catering, duty free, etc.

productPrice.definition: The price to which a product is sold.

productWarehouseQuantity.definition: The quantity of a product as measured in the warehouse, prior to departure or after landing.

baggage.definition: The cases, bags and equipment that a passenger takes with him/her when travelling.

baggageClaimUnit.definition: The number or name of the assigned baggage claim unit for the specific flight leg.

baggageMakeupBelt.definition: The baggage makeup belt assigned for outgoing bags.

alternateBaggageMakeupBelt.definition: The secondary, alternate baggage makeup belt assigned for outgoing bags.

flightBagCount.definition: The total number of bags carried in a specific flight leg.

passengerBagCount.definition: The number of bags carried in a specific flight leg by a passenger.

passengerBagID.definition: An identifier of the bags carried in a specific flight leg by a passenger.

passengerBagTagNumber.definition: The tag numbers of the bags carried in a specific flight leg by a passenger.

passengerBagSupplementaryTags.definition: The supplementary status tags of the bags carried in a specific flight leg by a passenger, e.g. priority, fragile, heavy, connection.

passengerBagType.definition: The type of the bags carried in a specific flight leg by a passenger.

passengerBagContainerSerialNumber.definition: The serial number of the container including the bags carried in a specific flight leg by a passenger.

passengerBagStatus.definition: The status of the bags carried in a specific flight leg by a passenger.

bagLocation.definition: The location(s) of the baggage count on the aircraft, i.e. Bin name or ULD ID. .

totalBagWeight.definition: The weight of total baggage loaded on the aircraft.

firstClassBagWeight.definition: The weight of the baggage loaded on the aircraft for first class passengers.

businessClassBagWeight.definition: The weight of the baggage loaded on the aircraft for business class passengers.

premiumEconomyClassBagWeight.definition: The weight of the baggage loaded on the aircraft for premium economy class passengers.

economyClassBagWeight.definition: The weight of the baggage loaded on the aircraft for economy class passengers.

priorityBagWeight.definition: The weight of the baggage loaded on the aircraft for priority passengers.

cargo.definition: The goods carried by an aircraft.

airWaybillNumber.definition: An air waybill or air consignment note is a receipt issued by an international airline for goods and an evidence of the contract of carriage, it is a document of title to the goods.

cargoWeight.definition: The total cargo weight of an aircraft.

cargoPieces.definition: The total number of cargo pieces loaded in an aircraft.

unitLoadDevices.definition: Information about the Unit Load Devices, e.g. Containers, Pallets, Pallet Nets.

specialHandlingInfo.definition: Information about the special handling of the cargo.

specialEquipmentNeeds.definition: Information about any need for special equipment.

goodsNature.definition: The nature of the goods transferred.

cargoLoadedDateTime.definition: The datetime the cargo was loaded in the aircraft.

cargoDeliveredDateTime.definition: The datetime the cargo was delivered.

shipperName.definition: The name of the shipper that sends the cargo.

consigneeName.definition: The name of the consignee to whom the cargo is sent.

operatingCarrier.definition: Details for the operating carrier for the cargo.

operatingAircraft.definition: Details for the operating aircraft for the cargo.

arrivalInstructions.definition: Details for arrival instructions of the cargo.

onloadInstructions.definition: Details for onload instructions of the cargo.

reportInstructions.definition: Details for report instructions of the cargo.

specialInstructions.definition: Details for any special instructions of the cargo.

cargoLoadFactor.definition: The percentage of cargo space filled by paid cargo.

cargoMailLoadFactor.definition: The percentage of mail in the cargo space.

crew.definition: A group of people who work together, operating an aircraft.

flightCrewCode.definition: The code of the flight crew of an airline.

CabinCrewCode.definition: A code associated with a specific cabin crew of a flight.

crewMemberID.definition: An ID to uniquely identify a crew member.
